description: From Old French statue, from Latin statua, derived from statuō (“set up or erect”).

entries.meaning: A three-dimensional work of art, usually representing a person or animal, usually created by sculpting, carving, molding, or casting.

examples: The young lady just then would have formed a graceful model for a statue of Attention

verbs.description: statue (third-person singular simple present statues, present participle statuing, simple past and past participle statued)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To form a statue of; to make into a statue.
examples: The whole man becomes as if statued into stone and earth.
